FuncDef: The check system-software command checks the checksum of the specified system software.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the name of the system software stored in the CF card.
The value is a string of 4 to 127 characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates the system software used to check the checksum of the specified system software.
-

Examples: Caution!!! Confirm to check startup file! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Info: The SHA256 hash value of the system software is 4b195c23d472197a5114a4ab727111813f3fb6a940e25cbc08d1afaacf7a4c3e.
Info: System software signature check passed!
Caution!!! Confirm to check startup file! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Info: The SHA256 hash value of the system software is 4b195c23d472197a5114a4ab727111813f3fb6a940e25cbc08d1afaacf7a4c3e.
Info: The system software verification hash is successful.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the system software is uploaded to the device for upgrade, running the check system-software command to check the checksum of the specified system software is recommended. This can avoid upgrade failure due to the error during the upload of the system software.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
When a user is upgrading versions in service or checking versions, others cannot check the checksum of the specified system software at the same time.
